title: [K-12] Inquiry-Based Self-Directed Learning Module for the Theory of Relativity

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of foundational physics (mechanics, electromagnetism) and mathematical fundamentals (algebra, trigonometry)
context.additional_context: Asynchronous learning with digital devices, providing process-oriented feedback through formative assessments

learning_goals: They can accurately explain the fundamental principles of the theory of relativity (e.g., the constancy of the speed of light, relativity of simultaneity) with over 85% accuracy.
They can analyze spacetime distortion phenomena using thought experiments and simulation tools to derive conclusions with over 70% accuracy.
They can independently perform the inquiry process (problem identification → hypothesis formulation → data analysis → conclusion derivation) within four weeks.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
